result.execSummary:
The defendant James H. McWilliams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days jail in lieu of $453.00 costs, concurrent with 20 day sentence.

With huber.  Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by April 29, 2016  for report date within 75 days or no later than June 24, 2016. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
